vulnerability_findings.name: use-ownable2step
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: contract BEP20Token is Context, IBEP20, Ownable {
vulnerability_findings.message: By demanding that the receiver of the owner permissions actively accept via a contract call of its own,  `Ownable2Step` and `Ownable2StepUpgradeable` prevent the contract ownership from accidentally being transferred  to an address that cannot handle it.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_owner == _msgSender(), "Ownable: caller is not the owner");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(newOwner != address(0), "Ownable: new owner is the zero address");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(sender != address(0), "BEP20: transfer from the zero address");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(recipient != address(0), "BEP20: transfer to the zero address");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(owner != address(0), "BEP20: approve from the zero address");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(spender != address(0), "BEP20: approve to the zero address");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function allowance(address owner, address spender) external view returns (uint256) {
vulnerability_findings.message:
BEP20Token.allowance.owner (local variable @ BEP20Token.sol#425) shadows:
	- Ownable.owner (function @ BEP20Token.sol#303-307)

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function _approve(address owner, address spender, uint256 amount) internal {
vulnerability_findings.message:
BEP20Token._approve.owner (local variable @ BEP20Token.sol#530) shadows:
	- Ownable.owner (function @ BEP20Token.sol#303-307)
